abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Second Rural Water
            Supply and Sanitation Project for Nepal is to undertake land
            policy and institutional reforms and key land administration
            pilots for laying the foundation for sustainable
            decentralized land administration system that is fair,
            efficient, and cost effective and ensures land tenure
            security. There is a need to reallocate eligible
            expenditures between the different categories under the
            original project. This has been caused by increase in unit
            costs, implementing more schemes serving a larger population
            than originally planned at preparation, thereby scope of
            works being more than originally anticipated in the schemes.
            The closing date of the project extended from the current
            December 31, 2010 to August 30, 2011. This will allow
            additional schemes to be completed and increase the number
            of beneficiary households, while scaling up innovative
            initiatives such as scheme insurance, social accountability
            and improving income generating activities, particularly of
            women. This will be the second extension of the closing
            date, representing a cumulative extension of just less than
            two years.
